evidence_span: Coating methods and coating materials that could be used to reduce the oxidation rate of zirconium-based alloy in a high-temperature steam environment were studied.

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: Regarding the coating materials tested at a $1 2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ in steam environment, the $\mathrm { S i O } _ { 2 }$ showed the greatest oxidation resistance among the tested materials

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: Si was more effective than $\mathrm { C r }$ in terms of oxidation resistance.

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: The PS coating technique has problems, such as the formation of pores in the Si-coated layer and interface oxidation caused by low adhesion during the hightemperature oxidation test at $1 2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } .$

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: the pores in the Si-coated layer were successfully removed, and the interface oxidation was suppressed by the formation of diffusion bonding between the Zircaloy-4 substrate and the $\mathrm { S i - Z r }$ mixed layer.

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: the oxidation resistance of the $\mathrm { S i - Z r }$ mixed layer was superior to that of Zircaloy-4, and good adhesion was obtained.

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: the hydrogen generation of zirconium alloy undergoing excess oxidation in a hightemperature steam environment can be considerably reduced by the application of Si coating via $\mathrm { P S } + \mathrm { L B S }$ technology.

source_id: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_010_chunk32
evidence_span: the coated cladding will be tested in the in-pile condition, as well as in a severe oxidation test such as a steam condition and in mixed conditions between steam and air at temperatures higher than $1 2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } .$
